pages.description: $(italic)Hematite is the oldest$(br)known iron oxide$(br)mineral that has ever formed on earth, and is widespread$(br)in rocks and soils.$()

$(italic)Limonite is an iron$(br)ore consisting of a$(br)mixture of hydrated iron(III) oxide-hydroxides in varying composition.$()$(br2)Limonite here is a combination of iron and nickel deposits lying deep in the earth.
